eu.MrSnowflake.android.droidgaming
Interface DroidGamingThread.GameListener

Enclosing class:
DroidGamingThread
public static interface DroidGamingThread.GameListener

GameListeners allow you to handle events in the rendering cycle. You should implement this interface to make games.

Author:
Maarten 'MrSnowflake' Krijn

Method Summary
 boolean onFrameEnd(DroidGamingThread parent, DroidGamingThread.GameEvent event)
          Called when the Frame ended rendering.

          Called when the Frame is started.

Method Detail

onFrameStart

boolean onFrameStart(DroidGamingThread parent,
                     DroidGamingThread.GameEvent event)
Called when the Frame is started. Handle your movements and other stuff here.

Parameters:
event - The GameEvent object containing information about the frame and state of the device.
Returns:
Whether to stop the game loop. Note this will immediately quit the loop, without completing the current frame.

onFrameEnd

boolean onFrameEnd(DroidGamingThread parent,
                   DroidGamingThread.GameEvent event)
Called when the Frame ended rendering.

Parameters:
event - The GameEvent object containing information about the frame and state of the device.
Returns:
Whether to stop the game loop. Note this will immediately quit the loop, without completing the current frame.

onRender

boolean onRender(DroidGamingThread parent,
                 android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
Draw to the canvas inside this function.

Parameters:
canvas - The canvas to draw to.
Returns:
Whether to stop the game loop. Note this will immediately quit the loop, without completing the current frame. TODO Check if this should be removed!
